title: How to Mark a Facebook Messenger Conversation As Spam

steps.title: Open the Messenger app.
steps.content: Open the Messenger app. This looks like a white lighting bolt in a multicolored speech bubble. Facebook Messenger already has features that automatically detect spam conversations. However, you can also manually report a conversation as spam. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the chat.
steps.content: Tap the chat. This should be listed on the Chats tab. If you aren't already on this tab, tap it at the bottom to navigate there now.

steps.title: Tap the user's name.
steps.content: Tap the user's name. This is at the top of the chat.

steps.title: Tap Report.
steps.content: Tap Report . You may need to scroll down to find this option.

steps.title: Select a reason.
steps.content: Select a reason. You can select: Harassment, Scams, Other, or another reason for the report .

steps.title: Tap Submit report.
steps.content: Tap Submit report . This is at the bottom.

steps.title: Block the user
steps.content: Block the user (optional). Return to the previous page and tap Block . At the top, tap Block messages and calls . Tap Block to confirm. At the bottom, tap Block on Facebook . Tap Block to confirm.

steps.title: Delete the chat (optional).
steps.content: Delete the chat (optional). Return to the Chats tab. Swipe left on the chat, and then tap Delete .

steps.title: Log into https://www.facebook.com/ in a web browser.
steps.content: Log into https://www.facebook.com/ in a web browser. You should see your feed.

steps.title: Click the Messenger icon.
steps.content: Click the Messenger icon. This is the lightning bolt in a speech bubble at the top-right corner.

steps.title: Click the chat.
steps.content: Click the chat. If the spam conversation is recent, you'll see it listed in the drop-down menu. If you need to search for it, click See all in Messenger to view all your chats.

steps.title: Click the "i" icon at the top.
steps.content: Click the "i" icon at the top. This is next to the sender's name.

steps.title: Click Privacy & support.
steps.content: Click Privacy & support . You can find this in the right panel. The menu will expand.

steps.title: Click Report.
steps.content: Click Report . A pop-up window will open.

steps.title: Select a reason.
steps.content: Select a reason. You can select: Harassment, Scams, Other, or another reason.

steps.title: Click Submit.
steps.content: Click Submit . This is the blue button at the bottom. Click the X to close the window when you're finished.

steps.title: Block the user (optional).
steps.content: Block the user (optional). You can find this option underneath the Privacy & support header in the right panel. Click Block twice to confirm. The user will no longer be able to message you, see your posts, or tag your profile.
